CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: AFM , TEM , and PL quenching measurements revealed that the high J sc s are a result of the appropriate morphology and efficient charge separation.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| AFM (Atomic Force Microscope) |
| TEM (Transmission Electron Microscope) |
| PL (Photoluminescence) |
| high J sc s (high junction Schottky barriers) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| AFM (Atomic Force Microscope) |
| TEM (Transmission Electron Microscope) |
| PL (Photoluminescence) |
| high J sc s (high junction Schottky barriers) - This is a material property, specifically a type of barrier. |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: AFM , TEM , and PL quenching measurements revealed that the high J sc s are a result of the appropriate morphology and efficient charge separation.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| AFM (Atomic Force Microscopy) |
| TEM (Transmission Electron Microscopy) |
| PL (Photoluminescence) |
| J sc (Joule Scattering) |
| morphology |
| charge separation |
| appropriate |
| efficient |
| result |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Joule Scattering (J sc) |
| morphology |
| charge separation |
| efficiency (implied by "efficient charge separation") |
| result |

AFM (Atomic Force Microscopy), TEM (Transmission Electron Microscopy), and PL (Photoluminescence) are methods or techniques used to investigate the material properties, not properties themselves.
